instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]macbook air early 2014 not turning on
threads.message:
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b which had water damage on rtc and smc reset circuit, i cleaned the pads and put cips back on, and it was working fine and now it has stopped again.
charger gets green light then turns to orange and have quarter  fan spin, i am fairly new at logic board repairs so please bear with me.
i checked <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PP_3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL> is missing and <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE_EN</SIGNAL> pulses to 1.5v and then goes to 0 volts.
i am not sure if <SIGNAL>PP_3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL> should be present all the times.
i have no idea where to start looking, anyone can help me with this

threads.title: [SOLVED]macbook air early 2014 not turning on
threads.message: So CPU Vcore is coming on and off? The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8 corroded? <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination resistors/traces corroded? Possible crap under the SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]macbook air early 2014 not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 33907"]So CPU Vcore is coming on and off? The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8 corroded? <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination resistors/traces corroded? Possible crap under the SMC.[/QUOTE]

should all pins of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> have 3.3 volts?

threads.title: [SOLVED]macbook air early 2014 not turning on
threads.message: fixed it, its was JTAG connector. can't believe i wasted 2 days for figuring that out
